Class Player

public class Player extends Object implements IPlayer
Class Player defines methods and properties inherited by all Player objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(int level) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructor for the Player class. Initializes Player's party with 4 distinct Pokemon objects, but does not yet set the battling Pokemon
      Parameters:
      level - int: Level parameter dictates potential strength of Pokemon
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when level < 1 or level > 3

  • Method Details

    • createParty

      public ArrayList<Pokemon> createParty(int level) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Method createParty() creates an ArrayList of 4 Pokemon for a Player to yse for battling. Level will dictate the upper bound for stats of the Pokemon in the party
      Specified by:
      createParty in interface IPlayer
      Parameters:
      level - int: Level parameter dictates potential strength of Pokemon
      Returns:
      ArrayList with 4 Pokemon objects
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when level < 1 or level > 3

    • getParty

      public ArrayList<Pokemon> getParty()
      Method getParty() returns a copy of the full ArrayList of Pokemon of the Player
      Specified by:
      getParty in interface IPlayer
      Returns:
      ArrayList representing the Player's party

    • getAttackSkills

      public ArrayList<Skill> getAttackSkills() throws IllegalStateException
      Method getAttackSkills() returns the ArrayList of Skills of the battling Pokemon
      Specified by:
      getAttackSkills in interface IPlayer
      Returns:
      ArrayList: ArrayList of Skills of the battling Pokemon
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when the isAlive() == false

    • setNextBattlingPokemon

      public ArrayList<String> setNextBattlingPokemon() throws IllegalStateException
      Method setNextBattlingPokemon() updates the Player's battling Pokemon with the next ready Pokemon in their party.
      Specified by:
      setNextBattlingPokemon in interface IPlayer
      Returns:
      ArrayList: list of String outputs of the actions that occurred. Potential outputs include withdrawing the previous battling Pokemon that fainted and releasing the next battling Pokemon
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when the isAlive() == false or when the current battling Pokemon has not fainted

    • isAlive

      public boolean isAlive()
      Method isAlive() checks if the IPlayer has a party with non-fainted Pokemon
      Specified by:
      isAlive in interface IPlayer
      Returns:
      boolean: true if there is at least 1 non fainted pokemon in the party else false
